intro: Melampyrum violaceum, commonly known as purple touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. These flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with two lips, and are typically arranged in racemes. Melampyrum violaceum is native to Europe and is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
